ai-tha-ap3:223.4_0: a mendicant who meditates on their spiritual companions,
ai-tha-ap3:225.1_0: If you’d be rid of form,
ai-tha-ap3:225.3_0: I am the Fortunate One’s Dhamma.
ai-tha-ap3:225.4_0: It’s all the fruits for knowledge.
ai-tha-ap3:226.1_0: of the teaching you rolled forth?”
ai-tha-ap3:226.4_0: this knowledge master is the fruit of knowledge,
ai-tha-ap3:227.1_0: Thinking, ‘May I have nothing to do with those of bad wishes,
ai-tha-ap3:227.3_0: A uneducated person is uneducated and unpracticed.
ai-tha-ap3:227.4_0: One should live wherever they like.
ai-tha-ap3:228.2_0: and you are steady in ethics,
ai-tha-ap3:228.4_0: let them stand at the head.”
ai-tha-ap3:229.1_0: I say this to you, good sir,
ai-tha-ap3:229.2_0: all those who have gathered here:
ai-tha-ap3:230.1_0: then I, having seen this first,
ai-tha-ap3:230.4_0: Assaji, a disciple of the Assaji,
ai-tha-ap3:232.2_0: Assaji, a disciple of the Assaji,
ai-tha-ap3:232.3_0: who lives in whatever place he lives.
ai-tha-ap3:233.3_0: sat down on the Community of monks.
ai-tha-ap3:233.4_0: placed me in the foremost position.
ai-tha-ap3:234.2_0: rebirth into all states of existence is eradicated,
ai-tha-ap3:235.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap3:236.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap3:237.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Sāriputta.
ai-tha-ap3:238.1_0: First the Elder Sāriputta’s first benefit.
